revised_title: Inhibition and Relaxation in Antagonistic Muscles: A Study of Reciprocal Innervation
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between the activity of antagonistic muscles, specifically the triceps and quadriceps, and demonstrates a phenomenon of reciprocal innervation. This occurs when one muscle of an antagonistic pair relaxes as its opponent contracts, and can be triggered by various stimuli, such as electrical or mechanical excitation.
